revision.comment: /* List of court-martialed officers of the Pakistan Armed Forces */
revision.text:
The '''Judge Advocate General Branch''' of the [[Pakistan Armed Forces]] is composed of [[Pakistani Military|Pakistan's Military]] senior officers, lawyers and [[Military justice|judges]] who provide legal services to the [[Pakistan Army|Army]], [[Pakistan Air Force|Air Force]], [[Pakistan Navy|Navy]], and [[Pakistan Marines|Marines]] at all levels of command. JAG branch comes directly under the [[Adjudant-General Branch]] of the army.<ref>{{Cite news | last= Cheema | first =Umar | coauthors = | title =Lal Masjid commandos seek Supreme Court’s intervention:Denied copies of court martial proceedings; ISPR declines comments | newspaper =[[The News International]] | location =[[Islamabad]], [[Islamabad Capital Territory]] | pages = | publisher =[[Jang Group of Newspapers]] | date =June 8, 2010 | url =http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=29350 | accessdate = }} </ref> The Judge Advocate General's Legal Service includes judge advocates, warrant officers, paralegal noncommissioned officers and junior enlisted personnel, and civilian employees.<ref>{{Cite news | last=Shah | first =Waseem Ahmad | coauthors = | title =Peshawar: PHC puts Judge Advocate General Branch (JAG) on notice in spying case | newspaper =[[Dawn (newspaper)|The Dawn News]] | location =[[Peshawar]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa|Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province]] | pages = | publisher =Dawn News Group | date =February 4, 2009 | url =http://www.dawn.com/2009/02/04/local22.htm | accessdate =2010 }}</ref> In Pakistan, the Judge Advocate General can have the rank of [[Lieutenant General (Pakistan)|Lieutenant-General]], [[Major-General|Major]] or [[Brigadier-General]]. The JAG is currently led by the combined [[Pakistan Armed Forces]]'s senior-rank officers that includes the [[Vice Admiral]]s of the [[Pakistani Navy|Navy]], [[Air Marshal]]s of the [[Pakistani Air Force|Air Force]], and the [[Lieutenant-General]]s of the [[Pakistani Army|Army]] whose names are kept highly classified.
The JAG officers provide legal help to the military in all aspects, in particular advising the presiding officers of courts-martial on military law. According to the military justice law of Pakistan Armed Forces, the JAG's ruled decision cannot be challenged in civilian courts nor the civilian court can interfere in JAG' court hearing.<ref>{{Cite news | last = | first = | coauthors = | title =Axed Pakistan Army commando opposed to ‘Lal Masjid’ operation still denied justice | newspaper = | location = | pages = | publisher = | date = | url =http://www.thaindian.com/newsportal/south-asia/axed-pak-army-commando-opposed-to-lal-masjid-operation-still-denied-justice_100376986.html | accessdate = }} </ref> <ref>{{Cite news| last = | first = | coauthors = | title =Civilian Courts cannot interfere in Military Courts decisions:Supreme Court of Pakistan | newspaper = | location = | pages =3–4 | language =Urdu | publisher =Jang Group | date =July 17, 2010 | url =http://jang.com.pk/jang/jul2010-daily/17-07-2010/main2.htm | accessdate = }}</ref> Recently, Chief of Army Staff (COAS) General [[Ashfaq Parvez Kayani]] ordered an inquiry into an Internet video that shows men in military uniforms executing six young men in civilian clothes. According to the ISPR, the military public organization, the Pakistan Army's JAG Branch's lawyers and investigators will be leading the investigation, and the investigation will be headed by a [[Major General]], a [[two-star general]] officer of Pakistan Army.<ref>http://www.nation.com.pk/pakistan-news-newspaper-daily-english-online/Politics/08-Oct-2010/COAS-orders-to-check-veracity-of-officials-video-footage</ref> In 2010, after the successful outcomes of [[Operation Janbaz]], and the captured terrorists are currently prosecuted in a military court, headed by one star rank Brigadier.<ref>{{Cite news | last = | first = | coauthors = | title =GHQ Attack: The case of 7 culprits is being heard in a military court of Pakistan Defence Forces | newspaper =Jang News Group | location =Islamabad | pages =3/4 | language =Urdu | publisher =Group Media of Jang news | year =2011 | url =http://jang.com.pk/jang/feb2011-daily/22-02-2011/main3.htm | accessdate = }} </ref>
==List of court-martialed officers of the Pakistan Armed Forces== *[[Lieutenant-General]] [[Ziauddin Butt]] - Pakistan Army *[[Pilot officer]] [[Anwar Peerzada]] - Pakistan Air Force *[[Major-General]] [[Zahirul Islam Abbasi]] - Pakistan Army *[[Major-General]] [[Tajammul Hussain Malik]] - Pakistan Army *[[Major General]] [[Ameer Faisal Alavi]] - Pakistan Army *[[Major General]] [[Akbar Khan (Pakistani Army officer)|Akbar Khan]] - Pakistan Army *[[Lieutenant-Colonel]] [[Raja Nadir Pervez]] - Pakistan Army *[[Admiral]] [[Mansurul Haq]] - Pakistan Navy *[[Colonel]] [[Shahid Bashir]] - Pakistan Army *[[Brigadier]] [[Brigadier Imtiaz|Imtiaz Ahmad]] - Pakistan Army *[[Squadron Leader]] [[Shahid Bashir|Nadeem Ahmad Shah]]- Pakistan Air Force *[[Squadron Leader]] ]] - Pakistan Air Force *[[Vice Admiral]] [[Muzaffar Hassan]] - Pakistan Navy *[[General]] [[Gul Hassan Khan]] - Pakistan Army *[[Air Marshal]] [[Abdul Rahim Khan]] - Pakistan Air Force
==See also== *[http://www.supremecourt.gov.pk/web/user_files/file/18th_amendment_order.pdf Nadeem Ahmed Advocate] - Supreme Court of Pakistan *[[General Zia|General Muhammad Zia-Ul-Haq]] - A notable JAG judge of the Pakistan Army who had headed numerous court-martial of the Pakistani army officer. *[[Rao Qamar Suleman]] - Current Air Chief Marshal of the Pakistan Air Force. *[[Judge Advocate General]]
==Notes== {{Reflist}} *[http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/the-newspaper/local/peshawar/isi-official-put-on-notice-in-missing-person-case-760] {{Military of Pakistan}}
